title.value: Bisimulation metrics and norms for real-weighted automata
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning of the paper, and it accurately reflects the main topic discussed.
title.quote: Bisimulation metrics and norms for real-weighted automata

extractions.description: This paper develops new bisimulation metrics for weighted finite automata (WFA), exploring spectral properties of linear operators and investigating continuity properties and undecidability results related to these metrics. The focus is on generalizing existing concepts in the theory and applying them to spectral learning of WFA.

type.justification: The paper primarily introduces new theoretical concepts and explores properties related to bisimulation metrics in weighted finite automata.
type.quote: We develop a new bisimulation (pseudo)metric for weighted finite automata (WFA) that generalizes Borealeâ€™s linear bisimulation relation.

name.justification: The paper is centered around developing metrics and norms within the context of weighted finite automata, indicating its focus on automata theory.
name.quote: Weighted finite automata (WFA) form a fundamental computational model that subsumes probabilistic automata and various other types of quantitative automata.

name.justification: The paper discusses applications to spectral learning of weighted automata, which is a subfield mentioned explicitly in the abstract.
name.quote: ...and give a preliminary account of applications to spectral learning of weighted automata.

name.justification: WFA is relevant to quantitative verification, as mentioned in the introduction, identifying it as a sub-area of focus.
name.quote: ...are certainly relevant to quantitative verification and to the theory of control systems.
